definitions.definition: to produce leaves, hair, or other new developing parts, or (of leaves, hair, and other developing parts) to begin to grow:
examples: It takes about three days for the seeds to sprout.

definitions.definition: If a large number of things sprout (up), they suddenly appear or begin to exist:
examples: New factories have sprouted up everywhere.

definitions.definition: a part of a plant that is just beginning to grow
